meanings.definition: A small silver coin used in Saudi Arabia.
meanings.sent1: I found a shiny halalah on the ground.
meanings.sent2: In Saudi Arabia, people use halalah for small purchases.
meanings.sent3: The halalah rolled away like a tiny, glinting pebble.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter tinkled like a handful of halalah.
meanings.sent5: The halalah sparkled in the sunlight, catching my eye.

meanings.definition: A unit of currency in Saudi Arabia, equal to one hundredth of a riyal.
meanings.sent1: I exchanged my riyal for halalah at the bank.
meanings.sent2: The price was just a few halalah short of a full riyal.
meanings.sent3: He juggled the halalah coins, pretending they were tiny planets.
meanings.sent4: The halalah scattered like confetti in the wind.
meanings.sent5: The sound of halalah clinking together was music to his ears.
